results.title: Edward John Eyre
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Bern Gandy and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film covers the route which Edward John Eyre explored in 1840 between Adelaide, South Australia, and Albany, Western Australia. Illustrates scenes along this route which skirts the Nullabor Plain and is now known as the Eyre Highway; Adelaide as it was when he left is reproduced from old drawings and contrasted with the Adelaide of today; Whyalla with its shipbuilding and iron industry; Eucla, deserted gold mining town, Coolgardie and Kalgoorlie; present-day Perth, now a big city.

results.title: Edge of the outback
results.brief_description: A picture of the life in the region of Longreach, Queensland, at the time of the annual Agricultural Show in a drought season. Without explicit commentary we candidly observe a grazier and his family over several days while they go about their family, business and social life

results.title: Edge of the deep
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Peter Bruce and Boolari Films
results.brief_description: The film illustrates the way of life on the sea shore. Many birds such as gulls, pelicans, swans and cormorants are shown and their adaptations to the tidal pattern explained. Migratory and breeding habits of other species are discussed. This poetic film of bird life is centred round two derelict barges which locate the scene and establish the continuity of the movements of the tide.

results.title: Easy way out
results.creator_credit: Sherman Beck, Temple Stemm and ACI Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the need for a constructive approach to drugs and alcohol. Through a novel analogy between the physical effort needed by chicks to hatch from eggs and the psychological effort needed by adolescents to mature, the viewer learns that struggle develops strength.

results.title: Earnings in conflict
results.brief_description: A proposal by Lord Wilfred Brown to combat the wages inflation in Great Britain. The narrative is set in the future, at a time when such a system has been adopted. An American TV interviewer is the linkman, making an enquiry into the “revolutionary” British procedure.

results.title: Early American civilizations (Mayan, Aztec, Incan)
results.brief_description: A description of three important civilisations that flourished before the Spanish conquest in the new world - Mayan, Aztec and Incan. This film stresses the economic background shared by all three cultures, an economy based on corn. Shows Mayan carvings, the Teotihuacano’s Pyramid of the Sun, the Aztec calendar stone, Incan weavings and other art objects and ruins.

results.title: Dung down under: a study in biological control
results.creator_credit: Roger Seccombe, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Domestic cattle drop 33 million tonnes of dung on Australian pastures every year. Pasture areas are reduced and fly pests, like the bushfly and the buffalo fly, thrive. Entomologists are seeking a solution to these problems through the dung beetle, which breaks up and disperses dung pads. Selected species of dung beetles imported from Africa are being mass bred in Australia for release in cattle breeding areas. Early results indicate that they will prove an outstanding example of biological control

results.title: Drugs in our time
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The first film in the series looks at the socioeconomic setting of drug abuse. Seeks reasons for rising use of drugs among young people, and concludes that children are making choices and it is up to adults to prepare them for this.

results.title: Drinking driving: Danger level
results.brief_description: Examines the effect of alcohol on driving performance. Scientific tests were carried out at Warwick Farm motor racing circuit, using drivers given carefully measured quantities of alcohol. From the results of these experiments, a danger level of alcohol consumption was able to be ascertained.

results.title: Dream
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: A partly animated film based on a series of drypoint prints (‘Movements’ and ‘Combats’) by Australian printmaker Charles Lloyd on the theme of aggression in society. The sound composition by Arthur Cantrill is a mix of percussion and altered piano (plucking and hitting strings and soundboard, played by Arthur Cantrill), sound effects (including breathing), and electronically modified children’s laughter, recorded on a Nagra reel to reel tape recorder and transferred to 16mm magnetic tracks which were laid and mixed in a professional sound studio, where reverberation was added to some sections.
